title: Bug 113047 - No children nodes listed when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes are not being listed. Upon creating a new data set without an SQL statement, and changing the data source in the data set editor's data source page to a new one that does not have any database/table/column information, the expected children nodes are not displayed. The issue persists even after closing the data set editor and reopening it.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. Open the data set editor page in the query tab.
3. In the data set editor's data source page, change the data source to a new one that does not have any database/table/column information.
4. Observe that the children nodes are not being listed.
5. Close the data set editor.
6. Reopen the data set editor.
7. Observe that the children nodes are still not being listed.
